reviewText: It is for a gift to be taken to cuba to teach small kids  thanks

this is Shelley the nanny and her puppets. the cover sint like the one it had in the 90's when i was a kid...that made it a little difficult to find. My kids love it and are learning a lot. We homeschool and unschool...and my son started trying to write while watching this video.

We stumbled upon the addition DVD at our library and my daughters enjoyed it so much I decided to find more of them. Purchasing the whole set was cheaper than buying them individually. We are currently watching the phonics series. The girls get a kick out of the puppet interaction. We are a homeschooling family so I use them to help teach while we are eating lunch/ getting ready.
Great learning DVDs . not that rowdy kind.

Great value for the money!  These videos teach phonics very well and go far more into the depth of phonetic understanding than do a lot of the other phonics videos.  There is nothing "creepy" about this series... as one reviewer strangely wrote.  Cute puppets are cleverly utilized to hold the children's attention; it worked for our kids!  These are remastered from a series done back in time; so the video quality isn't the best... but it's good enough to capture children's attention (while teaching them a whole lot), so that's plenty good enough for us!  Also highly recommended are the Rock-N-Learn Phonics and Learning Videos; they teach when others fail!
Very poor quality. Worse than Sesame Street. Repetitive and creepy.
